Body: Possible Duplicate:  Android tablet won’t reboot after rebooting using volume and power buttons  I 'think' I have bootloaded my device after pressing the Power+Volume buttons simultaneously to reboot it. Now, it isn't detected by my cmd adb devices and fastboot devices, this is even though I loaded the 'Android Bootloader Interface' as its driver. So how do I undo this state?
Title: How do you undo a Bootloaded Android Device?

history.Text: I 'think' I have bootloaded my device after pressing the power+volume buttons simultaneously to reboot it. Now, it isn't detected by my cmd 'adb devices' and 'fastboot devices', this is even tough I loaded the 'Android Bootloader Interface' as its driver. So how do I undo this state?
How do you undo a Bootloaded Android Device?

I 'think' I have bootloaded my device after pressing the Power+Volume buttons simultaneously to reboot it. Now, it isn't detected by my cmd `adb devices` and `fastboot devices`, this is even though I loaded the 'Android Bootloader Interface' as its driver. So how do I undo this state?

> **Possible Duplicate:**  > [Android tablet won’t reboot after rebooting using volume and power buttons](http://android.stackexchange.com/questions/37855/android-tablet-wont-reboot-after-rebooting-using-volume-and-power-buttons)  I 'think' I have bootloaded my device after pressing the Power+Volume buttons simultaneously to reboot it. Now, it isn't detected by my cmd `adb devices` and `fastboot devices`, this is even though I loaded the 'Android Bootloader Interface' as its driver. So how do I undo this state?
